page.title: The Fusion Reactor
page.text: The fusion reactor is a complex multi-block structure that generates power from hot [guide name=matter_plasma] in a high gravitational field.

page.title: Requirements
page.text: To start producing energy the first thing you need is to find a [block name=gravitational_anomaly]. Then you must build a [block name=fusion_reactor_controller]. The controller will highlight exactly where the anomaly needs to be for it to function properly.
The controller will also highlight a ring like structure around the anomaly. The anomaly being in the center of the fusion reactor.

page.title: Step One
page.text: Place 11 [block name=fusion_reactor_coil] around the ring in a pattern like the one above. You can also use [block name=fusion_reactor_io] instead of coils for input/output.

page.title: Step Two
page.text: Fill all the remaining spaces with [block name=machine_hull] blocks. You can also put two [block name=decomposer] blocks next to the controller instead of the [block name=fusion_reactor_coil].

page.title: Generating power
page.text: After you have completed the fusion reactor multi-block structure, the [item name=fusion_reactor_controller] will show information on the workings of the reactor.
You will then need to pump [guide name=matter_plasma] into the reactor using fluid pipes or a [block name=matter_pipe guide=matter_transport].

Unfortunately you will need another power source to kick-start the production of [guide name=matter_plasma] from your [block name=decomposer]. After the reactor has enough matter it will start generating power and will be sufficient to power the decomposers.

If you want to pump matter or extract power from the reactor but don't want to do it using the controller. You can replace a [block name=fusion_reactor_coil] with a [block name=fusion_reactor_io] and use it as your input/output. Multiple IO ports are allowed.
